definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: His trousers were neatly pressed and his new jacket was just so .
sentences.chinese: 他的裤子烫得很匀整，新外套也是如此。

sentences.english: I received a letter from her in her neat script .
sentences.chinese: 我收到她的字体很匀整的来信。

definition: venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
pleasant aftertaste in the back of the throat (esp. when drinking tea)
gunpowder tea, Chinese green tea whose leaves are each formed into a small pellet
unprocessed sun-dried tea leaves used to make black or green tea
to add water (or other liquid) to (another ingredient such as powdered milk or tea leaves)/to infuse (tea)
shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
a cake of tea, commonly Pu'er tea 普洱茶[Pu3 er3 cha2], compacted into a bowl or nest shape/dome shaped tea-brick/caked tea
